: ''For all other uses, please see [[Love (disambiguation)]]. ''
 
: ''For all other uses, please see [[Love (disambiguation)]]. ''
−
[[Image:Drawn_love_hearts.svg‎|thumb|right|The [[Heart (Symbolism and Metaphor)|heart]], a frequent modern symbol of love]]
+
[[Image:Drawn love hearts.svg‎|thumb|right|The [[Heart (Symbolism and Metaphor)|heart]], a frequent modern symbol of love]]
     
'''Love''' has many different meanings in [[English language|English]], from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something one would die for ([[patriotism]], pairbonding). It can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. Probably due to its psychological relevance, love is one of the most common themes in art.
 
'''Love''' has many different meanings in [[English language|English]], from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something one would die for ([[patriotism]], pairbonding). It can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. Probably due to its psychological relevance, love is one of the most common themes in art.

Line 176: Line 175:  
==Religious views==
 
==Religious views==
 
===Christian===
 
===Christian===
−
The Christian understanding is that love comes from God. The love of man and woman, eros in greek, and the unselfish love of others, agape, are often contrasted as 'ascending' and 'descending' love, respectively, but are ultimately the same thing. <ref>[http://www.vatican.va/holy_father/benedict_xvi/encyclicals/documents/hf_ben-xvi_enc_20051225_deus-caritas-est_en.html Pope Benedict XVI, papal encyclical, Deus Caritas Est.]</ref>
+
The Christian understanding is that love comes from God. The love of man and woman, eros in Greek, and the unselfish love of others, agape, are often contrasted as 'ascending' and 'descending' love, respectively, but are ultimately the same thing. <ref>[http://www.vatican.va/holy_father/benedict_xvi/encyclicals/documents/hf_ben-xvi_enc_20051225_deus-caritas-est_en.html Pope Benedict XVI, papal encyclical, Deus Caritas Est.]</ref>
     
There are several Greek words for Love that are regularly referred to in Christian circles.
 
There are several Greek words for Love that are regularly referred to in Christian circles.
